page.title: 02Ecology in Hannington
page.content: Hannington is situated in chalk downland, being itself on the claycap of the hilltops. This clay/flint soil was traditionally better farmland. It is at 650 Ft with little tree shelter resulting in lower temperatures & in- creased rainfall. The water is sup- plied by main pipeline from a borehole in Kingsclere. There is no main sewer- age service, each dwelling having its own cesspit or septic tank. The vil- lage is sited around a central green, (old water supply ponds) from which single tracks,footpaths & bridleways radiate to neighbouring villages & farms intersecting others on the way. The land is mainly arable, there re- mains some paddocks around village houses for horses. Pature land for cattle & sheep. Many of the houses have large productive vegetable plots. The annual average rainfall is 80 cm.
